intro: Weinmannia sylvicola, commonly known as the mountain weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in rocky or mountainous terrain, where it exhibits adaptations to cold and arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and leathery, helping to reduce water loss, while its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a variety of colors. Weinmannia sylvicola plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
